repnme.cdata!:
Colombia - First Programmatic Business
            Productivity and Efficiency Development Policy Loan Project

abstracts.cdata!:
This First Programmatic Business
            Productivity and Efficiency development Policy Loan Project,
            is the first phase of a programmatic development policy
            operation, to be implemented over three years. The first
            operation will support policy and institutional reforms in
            three areas: 1) enhancement of the business environment to
            promote investment and trade, and improve competitiveness of
            the productive sectors of the economy; 2) increase the
            soundness and depth of the financial system expansion of
            access to capital markets by businesses; and, 3) improved
            efficiency of financial secondary markets. It will
            facilitate the creation and operation of businesses, leading
            to increased productivity and employment levels; and, foster
            the sustainable growth of a financial and capital markets
            system that address the needs of individuals and of a
            productive sector. Notwithstanding, risks include: a)
            mechanisms for inter-institutional collaboration and
            coordination in support of entrepreneurial activities may be
            hampered by inter-agency rivalries; b) measures to increase
            access to financial services may take a long time to produce
            results; c) political uncertainty and potential
            deterioration in the internal security situation, may delay
            the implementation of institutional and regulatory reforms;
            and, d) current levels of public debt may pose a threat to
            overall macroeconomic stability.
